Go to |Tools| > |Remote Pairing| in the Vuze desktop client to find your Remote Access Code.
To configure a manual remote, try the Advanced Login. See the @@Guide for more help.
If you have any feature ideas, or would like to vote on what gets worked on next, please visit our Idea Bank\n If you like our app, please rate us on the Google Play Store!
If you don\'t have a torrent file, you can search for one using your remote machine\'s search templates. Simply click on the search button and type in a search term.
Your connection settings, such as IP address and port, are all managed by your Access Code
Sorry, feature \'%s\' requires a connection to a Vuze client. We\'d love it if you switched! ^_^
Your remote machine is running an old version of Transmission. Some (or all!) functionality may not work. For better results, please upgrade Transmission to 2.40 (RPC 14) or higher
Tap & Hold to multi-select. DONE to de-select.
You are connected to the internet via a mobile connection. Are you sure you want to %1$s now?
%1$s is not a valid torrent file. The first five bytes are %2$s
Welcome to the Swarm Discoveries View

This view displays content that is related in some way to the content that you are already downloading. You can read more about this feature on our Swarm Discoveries Wiki Page. \n\nBy default this feature does not allow tracker sites within your torrent files to be used to discover related torrent files. You may enable one of two sets of bittorrent tracker sites. Depending on the choice you make below the Swarm Discovery results may include torrent files that contain a limited pre-selected list of tracker sites, which list is based upon our good faith reasonable belief that those tracker sites only track or host content that is lawful and does not infringe upon the rights, including copyright, of any third party, but you assume, and we disclaim, all risk including of using those tracker sites. If you would like to enable those tracker sites after you read here about those sites and some risks of using them, select the option below.

Enable Vuze Pre-Selected Tracker Sites. I have read here and here about those sites and some risks of using them, and I understand and agree that Vuze has no responsibility whatsoever with my enabling this function and using any of those trackers. I agree that it is my responsibility to ensure that I am only downloading lawful and non-infringing content.
If you would like Swarm Discoveries to find files "related to" your existing torrent files from all sources, not just the Vuze Pre-Selected tracker sites, select the option below.

Enable all discoveries related to my existing torrent files, irrespective of what tracker sites the torrent contains. I have read here and here about those sites and some risks of using them, and I understand and agree that Vuze has no responsibility whatsoever with my enabling this function and using all discoveries. I agree that it is my responsibility to ensure that I am only downloading lawful and non-infringing content.
Any use of Vuze® or Vuze+™ that violates the rights of any person or entity is not allowed. More.
Additional Information and Warnings about this feature

For tracker sites not included in the tracker sites pre-selected by Vuze, we additionally warn that some of those tracker sites might be accused of being more likely to track torrent files that might infringe upon the rights of others, including copyright, and might include more \"adult\" content, some of which might be alleged to infringe upon the rights of others. \n\nGiven how Swarm Discoveries works, third party torrent files that might automatically be considered "related" to the torrent files on your device which are found by the way of either Vuze pre-selected tracker sites or \"all\" discoveries, might be "related" only by virtue of the fact that if you and other users have \"ABC.torrent,\" for example, and many or some of those other users have \"XXX.torrent,\" Swarm Discoveries might consider the \"XXX.torrent\" to be \"related\". You might want to take additional care in selecting what Swarm Discovery content you wish to download, as well as then make available for uploading.

I understand and agree. Enable all discoveries related to my existing torrent files, irrespective of what tracker sites the torrent contains. I have read here and here about those tracker sites and some risks of using them, and I understand and agree that Vuze has no responsibility whatsoever with my enabling this function. I agree that is my responsibility to ensure that I am only downloading lawful and non-infringing content.
Swarm Discoveries view requires a recent version of Vuze.\n\nThe next time you are near your remote machine, select |Help| > |Check For Updates| in Vuze to update to the latest build.
Changing this display name will not alter the save location of the torrent data
%1$s is not a valid torrent file. The first five bytes are %2$s \n\nYou might have better luck by downloading the torrent file using this device and adding the saved torrent file.
Could not open %1$s. Since you are on Kitkat (Android v4), it\'s most likely due to the file being on external storage or saved by another app to a location that we don\'t have permissions to read.
Thank you for your continued support. :3\n\nIf you enjoy using Vuze Remote, please take a moment to rate our app in the Play Store.
